default: (a) {@item shortsword|PHB} or (b) {@item rapier|PHB} or (c) one {@filter simple weapons|items|source=phb|category=basic|type=simple weapon}

classFeature.name: Unarmored Defense
entries: While you are not wearing any armor, your Armor Class equals 10 + your Dexterity modifier + your Charisma modifier.  You can't use a {@item shield|PHB} with this feature.

classFeature.name: Dancing Style
entries: At 1st level, you dedicate yourself to a Dancing Style. Your choice grants you features at 1st level and again at 5th, 11th, and 14th level.

classFeature.name: Dancer's Agility
entries: Starting at 2nd level you can take the {@action Disengage}, {@action Dodge} or {@action Dash} action as a bonus action on each of your turns, aDanDanceritionally you can put end to the prone condition without expending movement.

classFeature.name: Special Dance
entries: Starting at 2nd level you can use an action to grant any creature you choose within a 10 feet an amount of temporary hit points determined by your class table.

classFeature.name: Improved Movement
entries: Starting at 3rd level your walking speed increases by 10 feet and your climbing speed is equal to your walking speed, aDanDanceritionally at 6th level you become immune to difficult terrain, at 11th level your walking speed bonus becomes 20 feet instead of 10.

classFeature.name: Dancing Style feature
entries: you dedicate yourself to a dancing style. Your choice grants you features at 1st level and again at 5th, 11th, and 14th level.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, and again at 8th, 12th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or two ability scores by 1. As normal, you can't increase one of your ability scores above 20 using this feature.

classFeature.name: Spotlight
entries: Starting at 5th level, whenever you or a friendly creature within 30 feet of you must make a saving throw againts being charmed or frightened the creature gains a bonus to the saving throw equal to your Charisma modifier (with a minimum bonus of +1). You must be conscious to grant this bonus.

classFeature.name: Passion For The Stage
entries: Starting at 6th level you have advantage on saving throws against being charmed or Frightened.

classFeature.name: Elusive Dance
entries: Starting at 7th level whenever a creature makes an attack roll against you and doesn't have advantage on the roll, you can use your reaction to impose disadvantage on it. You must use this feature before you know the outcome of the attack roll.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, and again at 8th, 12th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or two ability scores by 1. As normal, you can't increase one of your ability scores above 20 using this feature.

classFeature.name: Evasion
entries: Beginning at 9th level, you can nimbly dodge out of the way of certain area effects, such as a red dragon's fiery breath or an ice storm spell. When you are subjected to an effect that allows you to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, you instead take no damage if you succeed on the saving throw, and only half damage if you fail.

classFeature.name: Reliable Performance
entries: Starting at 10th level Whenever you make an ability check that lets you aDanDancer your Charisma bonus, you can treat a d20 roll of 9 or lower as a 10.

classFeature.name: Dancing Style feature
entries: you dedicate yourself to a dancing style. Your choice grants you features at 1st level and again at 5th, 11th, and 14th level.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, and again at 8th, 12th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or two ability scores by 1. As normal, you can't increase one of your ability scores above 20 using this feature.

classFeature.name: Sudden Dance
entries: Starting at 13th level you can aDanDancer your Charisma modifier to your initiative and the one of your allies, you can use this privilege again after completing a long rest.

classFeature.name: Dancing Style feature
entries: you dedicate yourself to a dancing style. Your choice grants you features at 1st level and again at 5th, 11th, and 14th level.

classFeature.name: Unrestrainable
entries: Starting at 15th level you have advantage on saving throws made against the Grappled and Restrained conditions.

classFeature.name: Invigorating Dance
entries: Starting at 15th level when you use Special dance you can choose one creature, you can give that creature an aDanDanceritional action on its next turn.

classFeature.name: Perfect Body
entries: Starting at 16th level you gain proficiency in all saving throws

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, and again at 8th, 12th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or two ability scores by 1. As normal, you can't increase one of your ability scores above 20 using this feature.

classFeature.name: Incredible Footwork
entries: Starting at 17th level when you are hit by a weapon attack you can use your reaction to make the attack miss regardless of the roll. You can use this privilege a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus per long rest.

classFeature.name: Flattering Audience
entries: Starting at 18th level when you roll a 1 when you use your special dance privilege, you can reroll the die and must use the new roll, even if the new roll is a 1.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, and again at 8th, 12th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or two ability scores by 1. As normal, you can't increase one of your ability scores above 20 using this feature.

classFeature.name: Dance Mastery
entries: Starting at 20th level your Charisma and Dexterity scores increase by 4. Your maximum for those scores is now 24.

subclassFeature.name: Bonus Proficiencies
entries: {@i 1st-level Martial Style feature}
you gain proficiency with Glaive, Halberd, Lance and Pike.

subclassFeature.name: Martial Step
entries: {@i 1st-level Martial Style feature}

whenever you finish a long rest, you can choose one weapon that you are proficient with. When you attack with that weapon, you can use your Charisma modifier, instead of Strength or Dexterity, for the attack and damage rolls. This benefit lasts until you finish a long rest or choose a different weapon.

subclassFeature.name: Martial Exhibition
entries: {@i 5th-level Martial Style feature}
when a creature is affected by special dance you can also grant it a bonus equal to your charisma modifier on its next Melee weapon attack until the end of its next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Surprising Attack
entries: {@i 11th-level Martial Style feature}
you can use your action to make an attack against every creature within the range of your melee weapon. You can use this privilege once for long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Nimble Dancer
entries: {@i 14th-level Martial Style feature}
Starting at 14th level when you take the dodge action you can aDanDancer your proficiency bonus to your armor class.

subclassFeature.name: Ritual Dance
entries: You augment your Dancing prowess with the ability to cast spells. See {@book chapter 10|PHB|10} for the general rules of spellcasting and {@book chapter 11|PHB|11} for the {@filter bard spell list|spells|class=bard}.

entries.name: Cantrips
entries: You learn two cantrips of your choice from the {@filter bard spell list|spells|class=bard}. You learn an aDanDanceritional bard cantrip of your choice at 5th and 10th level.

entries.name: Spell Slots
entries: The Arcane Style Spellcasting table shows how many spell slots you have to cast your {@filter bard spells|spells|class=bard} of 1st level and higher. To cast one of these spells, you must expend a slot of the spell's level or higher. You regain all expended spell slots when you finish a long rest.
For example, if you know the 1st-level spell {@spell shield} and have a 1st-level and a 2nd-level spell slot available, you can cast {@spell shield} using either slot.

entries.name: Spells Known of 1st-Level and Higher
entries: You know two 1st-level bard spells of your choice.

The Spells Known column of the Arcane Style Spellcasting table shows when you learn more bard spells of 1st level or higher. Each of these spells must be of a level for which you have spell slots. For instance, when you reach 7th level in this class, you can learn one new spell of 1st or 2nd level.

Whenever you gain a level in this class, you can replace one of the bard spells you know with another spell of your choice from the bard spell list. The new spell must be of a level for which you have spell slots.

entries.name: Spellcasting Ability
entries: Charisma is your spellcasting ability for your bard spells. You use your Charisma whenever a spell refers to your spellcasting ability. In aDanDancerition, you use your Charisma modifier when setting the saving throw DC for a Bard spell you cast and when making an attack roll with one.

subclassFeature.name: Inspiring Exhibition
entries: {@i 5th-level Arcane Style feature}
When a caster is affected by special dance you can also grant him a bonus equal to your charisma modifier on his Spell Save DC until the end of his next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Step
entries: {@i 11th-level Arcane Style feature}
you can cast a cantrip after using the special dance privilege.

subclassFeature.name: Encore
entries: {@i 14th-level Arcane Style feature}

when you see a creature cast a spell with a spell slot you have, you can use your reaction to memorize the spell, you can then use your action to cast the memorized spell without expending a spell slot, you can use this feature again after completing a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Dance Mastery
entries: {@i 1st-level Alluring Style feature}

Choose two of your skill proficiencies, or one of your skill proficiencies and your proficiency with disguise kit. Your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make that uses either of the chosen proficiencies. At 6th level, you can choose two more of your proficiencies (in skills or with disguise kit) to gain this benefit.

subclassFeature.name: Charming Step
entries: {@i 5th-level Alluring Style feature}

starting at 5th level once per turn when you enter melee range of an enemy you can make him do a charisma saving throw against your step DC, if they fail the saving throw they are charmed by you until you or your companions do anything harmful to it or a minute passes. If a creature succeded the saving throws they are immune to this feature for 1 hour

subclassFeature.name: Charismatic Presence
entries: {@i 11th-level Alluring Style feature}

When you or another creature you can see within 30 feet of you makes an ability check or a saving throw, you can use your reaction to aDanDancer your Charisma modifier to the roll. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of once). You regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: The Greatest Distraction
entries: {@i 14th-level Alluring Style feature}

Starting at 14th level you can choose a creature that you can see within 30 feet, that creature has to pass a charisma saving throw against your **Step Dc**, otherwise that creature movement becomes 0 and every attack made to that creature has advantage for 1d4 round.

subclassFeature.name: Exceptional Interpretation
entries: {@i 1st-level Theatrical Style feature}

When you see a creature make an ability check you can use your reaction to memorize the roll, when you make the same ability check you can use the same result if the roll is made within an hour. You can only have one roll memorized this way.

subclassFeature.name: Fearfull Step
entries: {@i 5th-level Theatrical Style feature}

starting at 5th level once per turn when you enter melee range of an enemy you can make him do a charisma saving throw against your step DC, if they fail the saving throw they are Frightened by you for a minute, If a creature succeded the saving throws they are immune to this feature for 1 hour

subclassFeature.name: Amazing Troupe
entries: {@i 11th-level Theatrical Style feature}

When you make a Charisma (Deception) and Charisma (Performance) check to pass off as a different person you can give a bonus equal to your charisma modifier to any creature of your choice that is trying to do the same.

subclassFeature.name: Character or Reality?
entries: {@i 14th-level Theatrical Style feature}

your thoughts can't be read by telepathy or other means, unless you allow it. You can present false thoughts by succeeding on a Charisma (Deception) check contested by the mind reader's Wisdom (Insight) check. ADanDanceritionally, no matter what you say, magic that would determine if you are telling the truth indicates you are being truthful if you so choose, and you can't be compelled to tell the truth by magic.
